div.div:
The Board of Education Live Stream
(function(d, s, c, o) {var js = d.createElement(s), fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];var h = (('https:' == document.location.protocol) ? 'https:' : 'http:');js.src = h + '//js.boxcast.com/v3.min.js';js.onload = function() { boxcast.noConflict()('#boxcast-widget-'+c).loadChannel(c, o); };js.charset = 'utf-8';fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);}(document, 'script', 'mh4ojcccrxwjfmcievzh', {"showTitle":0,"showDescription":0,"showHighlights":0,"showRelated":false,"defaultVideo":"next","market":"high-school","showDocuments":false,"showIndex":false,"showDonations":false}));
To call in to ask a question or make a comment, please dial 609-653-0100 ext 1417 during the public comment portion of the meeting.
*Please do not leave a voicemail message for public comment as it will not be received, continue to call until you reach live operator/moderator. Due to call volume, this may require you to attempt to call multiple times.
*Please anticipate a 30-second delay for the broadcast to reach the stream.
We thank you for your patience as we work through this new Virtual Board meeting as part of our response to the Governor's Stay-at-Home Executive Order 107.

span.span: Students on Free or Reduced lunch status will be provided free meals during the time of the temporary closure. If you have any questions or concerns: contact 609-383-1464 or email beckt@eht.k12.nj.usIf your family's circumstances have changed since COVID-19 closure, you may qualify for the free and reduced lunch program. div.div: David C Milnes, Piano and AP Music Theory Teacher and Jazz band director at Egg Harbor Township High School, Will be honored with the Music Education Innovator Award given by the Give A Note Foundation in November.
div.a: Read More about EHTHS Teacher Receives National Award

a.title: MILLER ELEMENTARY SCHOOL WINS $25,000 TECHNOLOGY MAKEOVER GRAND PRIZE

div.a: MILLER ELEMENTARY SCHOOL WINS $25,000 TECHNOLOGY MAKEOVER GRAND PRIZE
div.div: The future is looking bright for Dr. Joyanne D. Miller Elementary School thanks to a small group of fifth graders who learned that six heads are better than one. The students succeeded in creating a three-pronged grand prize-winning presentation that answered the $25,000 question: “What Will School Look Like In The Future?” and scored their school a technology makeover in the process.
div.a: Read More about MILLER ELEMENTARY SCHOOL WINS $25,000 TECHNOLOGY MAKEOVER GRAND PRIZE
